summary: DT: THE CONSUMER  PURCHASED A 2006 VIKING EPIC POP UP TRAILER. THE ROOF SYSTEM WAS NOT WORKING CORRECTLY. THE ROOF SYSTEM WAS NOT RELEASING. WHEN PUTTING THE ROOF DOWN HAD TO SHAKE AND HIT THE ROOF AND THE SIDE BARS, THEN THE ROOF DROPPED  WITHOUT NOTICE WITH INCREDIBLE FORCE. THE CONSUMER WAS  PETRIFIED THAT SOMEONE COULD BE SERIOUSLY INJURED.  THE  CONSUMER TALKED TO THE DELIVERY PEOPLE, AND THEY SAID THAT WAS HOW IT WAS MADE AND IT WOULD TAKE TIME TO BREAK  IT IN. THEY OWNER TOOK THE CAMPER ON A TRIP AND THE TRAILER TOP WOULD NOT RELEASE PROPERLY. HAD TO BE HIT NUMEROUS TIMES WITH CONSUMER'S HANDS AND FIST AND THEN THE ROOF COLLAPSED WITH INCREDIBLE FORCE. THE OWNER HAS RECEIVED NHTSA RECALL 05V364000 LET IN THE MAIL ON THE ROOF SYSTEM ON  8-20-2005.   THE RECALL STATED FOR THE  CONSUMER NOT TO USE THE TRAILERS BECAUSE OF THE POTENTIAL FOR THE ROOF COLLAPSING UNEXPECTEDLY CONSUMER  TALKED TO  DEALER, AND THE DEALER STATED THAT THEY KNEW ABOUT THE RECALL, BUT THEY COULD NOT FIX IT. THE DEALER HAS NOT RECEIVED ANY INFORMATION FROM VIKING ON HOW TO FIX THE TRAILERS. THE DEALER DENIED KNOWING ANYTHING ABOUT THE RECALL PRIOR TO CONSUMER'S PURCHASING  OF THE TRAILER TWO WEEKS EARLIER.  THE OWNER WAS UPSET THAT HE HAD TO PAY $8,500.00 FOR A TRAILER THAT WAS COLLAPSING AND ENDANGERING HIS CHILDREN LIVES.  *AK
